text: Melipotis agrotoides is a species of moth in the family Erebidae. It is found in Jamaica, Venezuela, Mexico (Yucatán, Mérida),nkis.info El Salvador and the southern United States, where it has been recorded from California, Arizona and Texas. The wingspan is about 47 mm for males and 48 mm for females.mothphotographersgroup Adult males have a large square shaped pale patch on the basal part of the forewings. There is a black band on the hindwings that terminates before the anal angle.Bug Guide ==References== Category:Moths described in 1858 Category:Melipotis
title: Melipotis agrotoides
